required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Gum Disease Treatment on Long-term Dental Implant Success
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Periodontal Care Response on Implant Treatment Outcomes at Long-term

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the influence of periodontal care response on long term dental implant success. Investigator's hypothesis is that patients who do not well respond to periodontal care have more chance to develop peri-implant complications at long-term. The second purpose of this study is to evaluate the influence of other local, systemic, behavioral, and implant's related risk factors

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of peri-implantitis as measured by probing depth
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least 3 years after dental implant placement
primary_outcome.description: The implant has a probing depth more than or equal to 4 mm

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of peri-implantitis as measured by erythema
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least 3 years after dental implant placement
primary_outcome.description: The implant has bleeding on probing

primary_outcome.measure: Presence of peri-implantitis as measured by radiographic bone loss
primary_outcome.time_frame: At least 3 years after dental implant placement
primary_outcome.description: The implant has a radiographic bone loss when compared to previous radiographs

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At least 3 years after dental implant placement
secondary_outcome.description: presence of implant on arch Peri-implant mucositis: presence of bleeding on probing

intervention.description: Patients attending periodontal and implant treatment at the Department of Periodontology of the Dental Faculty at Strasbourg, France, between 2000-2015.

study_pop.textblock: Patient attending periodontal and implant treatment at the Department of Periodontology of the Dental Faculty at Strasbourg, France, between 2000-2015.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patient attending supporting periodontal therapy with at least one implant placed for more than 3 years
- Patient with more than 12 teeth at baseline
- Patient with demographic, periodontal, implant data recording
- patient aged >30 years at Baseline
Exclusion criteria:
- Patient needed antibiotic prophylaxis
- Uncontrolled diabetes
- Systemic inflammatory or autoimmune diseases
